channel.title: LatAm Prompt News Digest
channel.description: A daily digest of curated Latin American news.

item.title: LatAm Prompt News Digest - August 15, 2025
item.author: LatAm Prompt News Feed
item.description:
A Cloud Forest in Ecuador Is Crying for Help — The New York Times

Ecuador’s ecological progress is threatened by a series of reforms steamrolled by its young populist president, Daniel Noboa.

A Chaotic Gold Rush Is Helping Bolivia Prop Up Its Finances — Bloomberg

A Chaotic Gold Rush Is Helping Bolivia Prop Up Its Finances

Evo Morales, Barred from Bolivia’s Election, Urges Null Votes — The New York Times

Despite being barred from running again for president and being sought for arrest, a towering figure of Bolivian politics is trying to rally supporters to cast null votes.

Bolivia election could see lurch to right as once-dominant party’s time runs out — The Guardian

The two leading presidential candidates are both rightwingers and the leftist party of former president Evo Morales faces potential extinction In Plaza Murillo, the heart of Bolivia’s political capital, La Paz – and home to the presidential palace, parliament and the country’s main Catholic cathedral – time may be running out for a clock that runs backwards. Installed atop of the congressional palace during the years of prosperity under former president Evo Morales, 65, the clock was conceived as a symbol of the “decolonial and anti-imperialist” worldview championed by the left. Continue reading...

American Influencer Stuck Off Antarctica for 6 Weeks Says It’s ‘Isolating and Lonely’ — The New York Times

Ethan Guo, a 20-year-old pilot and content creator, said that he has been effectively trapped at a Chilean base since June. The authorities had said he landed there without permission.

A martyr in the making? — The Economist

The killing of a senator may reshape Colombian politics

Bolivia’s crazy kingdom of coca — The Economist

Former leader Evo Morales is hiding out there

Liberal Uruguay and the right to die — The Economist

Could its approach spread across Latin America?
